skill.description: Use when designing, architecting, or planning a new system from requirements or ideas - transforms concepts into navigable design catalog using EventStorming methodology, Mermaid diagrams, and progressive elaboration through 5 phases (Requirements, Big Picture, Processes, Data/Flows, Integration)

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It provides methodology and templates for system design using EventStorming and Mermaid diagrams. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: Transform vague requirements into clear system designs. Use EventStorming methodology to create navigable design catalogs with Mermaid diagrams.
actual_capabilities: Produces ERD, state charts, and sequence diagrams
Embeds all diagrams in README for easy preview
limitations: Requires user interaction for each phase
Mermaid format required for all diagrams

use_cases.title: Design new microservices architecture
use_cases.description: Transform business requirements into event-driven system design with clear service boundaries and integration points.

use_cases.title: Plan MVP system boundaries
use_cases.description: Define system scope and key processes before development begins, ensuring alignment with business goals.

use_cases.title: Create shared design documentation
use_cases.description: Build visual design artifacts that the whole team can reference during implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Start
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to design a new system for managing online course registrations. Help me create a complete design catalog using EventStorming methodology.

prompt_templates.title: E-commerce Platform
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an e-commerce platform where multiple vendors can sell products. Include inventory management, payment processing, and order fulfillment.

prompt_templates.title: SaaS Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a system design for a multi-tenant SaaS application with user management, billing, and API access control.

prompt_templates.title: Event-Driven Refactor
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me redesign our monolithic order management system using event-driven architecture. Focus on order lifecycle and inventory updates.

best_practices: Ask questions instead of making assumptions about requirements
Focus on 2-4 critical processes rather than detailing everything
Use Mermaid diagrams to visualize instead of writing lengthy prose
Mark unclear areas as hotspots instead of guessing solutions
anti_patterns: Skipping requirements phase and jumping to implementation details
Creating ASCII diagrams instead of using Mermaid format
Including database schemas or deployment guides in design phase
Assuming industry standards without confirming with stakeholders

faq.question: What is EventStorming?
faq.answer: EventStorming is a collaborative workshop method that uses events as the primary mechanism for understanding complex business domains and designing systems.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing systems?
faq.answer: This skill is optimized for new system design. For existing systems, consider using feature design or refactoring approaches instead.

faq.question: How detailed should the design be?
faq.answer: Stay at conceptual level. Define entities, relationships, and flows without specifying technologies, database schemas, or deployment details.

faq.question: What if I need more than 4 processes detailed?
faq.answer: Focus on the most critical processes first. You can always return to Phase 3 to add more processes after completing the initial design.

faq.question: How do I share the design with my team?
faq.answer: The skill creates a design catalog in docs/design-catalog/ with a README containing all diagrams. Share this directory or host it in your documentation platform.

faq.question: Can I modify the design later?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports iterative refinement. You can return to any phase to update requirements, processes, or data models as understanding evolves.
